Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred in determining that the applicants are not Convention refugees or persons in need of protection
Evidence_Type: Incidents involving Roma, state protection measures, reports on violence against Roma
Legal_Provision: Definition of Convention refugee and person in need of protection under IRPA
Basis_of_Claim: Persecution based on membership in a particular social group (Roma)
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Adequacy of state protection in the Czech Republic
Application_Error: Alleged failure to properly assess risk and state protection
Evidence_Ignored: Applicants' claims of increasing violence and inadequate investigations
Legal_Standard: Well-founded fear of persecution; risk to life or cruel treatment
Application_Factor: Membership in particular social group, country conditions
Decision_Outcome: Claim dismissed; applicants not found to be refugees or in need of protection
Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board, Federal Court
Decision_Review_Issue: Alleged errors in legal test application and bias
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA sections on Convention refugees and persons in need of protection
Cause_of_Refusal: Sufficient state protection in the Czech Republic; lack of well-founded fear
Evidentiary_Issues: Weight given to evidence on state protection and anti-Roma violence
Procedural_Fairness: Allegations of bias reviewed and dismissed
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to Board's interpretation of protection availability
Procedural_Issue: Scope of judicial review, adequacy of reasoning
Omission_Type: Failure to find systemic failure in state protection
